text: what does an airplane tell you about the
European Union it all looked very
different British Airways really did fly
the national flag it was pretty much the
only British airline that was allowed to
fly in and out of the country back then
our government made an individual
agreement with each and every country
that we flew to only two airlines were
allowed to fly any particular route they
limited the number of passengers that
could fly every week and they set the
prices Britain and the Dutch led Europe
in reducing these restrictions the
European community followed our lead and
now any EU airline can fly from any
country to another one
we've got cheaper flights more choice
and more pollution environmentalists say
we've also got better compensation
rights if and when our flights are
delayed would all of this change if we
were to leave the EU that I'm afraid is
yet another thing that it's impossible
serve with drinks and cigarettes which
will be available in ten minutes
